Jim and all,
I have Kano Natsuo Meihin Shu but the volume I mentioned earlier is
apparently the one to get, it is the collected illustrations of the 8 volume
set published later in one volume by Chugoku Pearl Hambai. I have never seen
it as it is very hard to find.
Alan
----- Original Message -----
From: "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 13, 2004 10:22 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba designs? Natsuo books


Alan and all,
Another option is a book I use which is Kano Natsuo Meihin Shu by Ikeda.
It's a single volume published in 1972.  It covers his tsuba, kodogu, some
paintings, non-sword metal work, etc.  Even a photo or two of Natsuo
himself.

Jim



  Matt, Jim,
  There was an 8 volume Natsuo set in last June's sale at Christie's
estimated
  at ï¿½1000-1500, it didn't sell. It is basically text with the illustrations
  spread throughout the set, there was however a single volume of all the
  illustrations published separately, this is the one to get if you can find
  it.
  Alan
